#gabay #pyconph2024 #pyconph #pythonph

About the Speaker:
Zorex Salvo is the Chairperson for PyCon PH 2024, Board of Trustee at PythonPH, and Software Engineer at TotalRewards Software

title: PyCon Philippines 2024 - Keynote 1: Simulating Disaster Relief...  by Reina Reyes and JC Peralta
description:
Keynote 1: Simulating Disaster Relief Distribution and Transport Network Efficiency During Typhoons by Reina Reyes

In this talk, the speakers presented a data-driven simulation and analysis of relief delivery efficiency in the Visayas transport network during Typhoon Haiyan and showcase an open-source decision support tool, developed using Python, which can simulate different typhoon paths and new food hub locations. 

It's is their hope that policymakers will harness the potential from this data-driven tool for informed decision-making, strategic cost-benefit analysis for infrastructure investments, and effective data-driven transportation planning to enhance resilience in the face of future disasters. 

About the Speakers:
Reina Reyes is a Associate Professor at National Institute of Physics in UP Diliman, and Consultant at Z-Lift Solutions and WeSolve Foundation

JC Peralta is a Data Scientist, Geospatial Machine Learning Consultant, and a Climate Scientist

--

We invite you to join us in celebrating PyCon Philippines 2024 - where "Gabay" (guide) steers our collective journey of growth and relentless improvement.

#gabay #pyconph2024 #pyconph #pythonph

For more details about PyCon Philippines 2024, please visit: https://pycon-2024.python.ph/

title: PyCon Philippines 2024 - Keynote 2: The State of Python in 2024 by Michael Kennedy
description:
The State of Python in 2024

In this talk, Michael Kennedy gave a look at the current-day broader Python ecosystem. Explored questions such as: What are the important trends to keep an eye one? How have the traditionally popular frameworks such as Flask and Django adapted to some of the latest modern Python trends (e.g. async/await). What new frameworks and libraries are (about to) take the Python scene by storm? How is Python getting faster, dropping or sidestepping the GIL, and more? Why Python web frameworks are better choices than ever.

About the Speaker:
Michael Kennedy is the founder of Talk Python Training, host of the Talk Python To Me podcast, Python Software Foundation Fellow, and an entrepreneur.

---

We invite you to join us in celebrating PyCon Philippines 2024 - where "Gabay" (guide) steers our collective journey of growth and relentless improvement.

title: PyCon Philippines 2024 - Addressing Industry Challenges through Community Collaboration
description:
Title: [Panel Discussion] Python in APAC: Addressing Industry Challenges through Community Collaboration

In PyCon PH 2024, we hosted a compelling panel discussion with PyCon organizers and leading industry figures. This session aimed to spotlight the dynamic relationship between the Python community and the industry across the Asia-Pacific. Through engaging discussions, our panelists examined and highlighted the impact of Python-driven initiatives on industry progress and the ways future collaborations could be developed for mutual benefit.

Moderator: Ivy Fung, PyCon MY

Panelists:
- APAC PyCon Organizers: Discussing community trends, challenges, and Python’s impact. Featuring Ciara Bautista (PyLadies Manila), Matt Lebrun (PythonPH), and Iqbal Abdullah (PyCon JP).
Industry Voices:

- Insights from the field with Jasper Sibayan (Engineering Manager, BillEase) and Jan Aaron Angelo Lee (CTO, Swarm).

We invite you to join us in celebrating PyCon Philippines 2024 - where "Gabay" (guide) steers our collective journey of growth and relentless improvement.

#gabay #pyconph2024 #pyconph #pythonph

For more details about PyCon Philippines 2024, please visit: https://pycon-2024.python.ph/

title: PyCon Philippines 2024 - Keynote 3: AI and Programmers - Partners or Rivals? by Matt Harrison
description:
AI and Programmers - Partners or Rivals?

It is a time of uncertainty. Rumors and evidence of mass layoffs. Folks having a hard time getting employment. AI replacing employees. How do we evolve and adapt to the unprecedented progress that AI has made recently?

This talk aims to encourage folks to progress and how to standout amidst peak AI.

About the Speaker:
Matt Harrison is the author of Effective XGBoost and Effective Pandas and he's a computer science expert

title: PyCon Philippines 2024 - Lightning Talks
description:
Lightning Talks are impromptu presentations that offer a welcoming platform. This allowed participants to showcase projects, share tips, and express what makes Python enjoyable. This segment celebrated the diverse interests and ideas within our community, all within a few minutes. Whether for first-time speakers or seasoned presenters, it was all about the joy of sharing in a supportive environment.

List of Lightning Talks and Presenters:
- Torch Geo by Ian Panganiban
- Python in Salmon (Fintech Startup) by Kirill Tribunskii
- Decorate your life with Python by Jabez Emmanuel Borja
- FIR Coefficients as Weights by Justin Garcia
- UP Citizen Science Network by Chris
- The print function by Marvin Tensuan
- Computational Physics Class Project by Juan Eduardo Banzon
- Python for Mobile Development by Mark Anthony Estospace
- Understanding the Nature of Volunteer-Driven Organizations by Matt Lebrun
- PSF and Python Community by KwonHan Bae
- Remote code execution in a billion-dollar publicly traded company by Ted Mathew dela Cruz
- Ortholinear Keyboard by Eman
- Machine Learning by Christian Darvin 
- Termux by Andresito de Guzman
- 5 Projects of PCHRD
- Impact-Based Food Forecasting System in the Philippines by Faye Andal
- PyCon APAC Organizers Website (pycon.asia) by Micaela Reyes
- Document Automation Pipeline by Arnel
- Citizen data as mass mobilization

title: PyCon Philippines 2024 - PyNight Highlights
description:
PyNight (featuring PyTunes)

Wrapped up a day of learning and coding with a relaxed evening. We chilled out, enjoyed serenading melodies, and shared stories from the day. This mix of music and open mic sessions allowed volunteers and guests to showcase their talents or simply share a laugh, offering the perfect way to unwind and bond with the community.
